meanings.definition: A loose-fitting garment, typically knee-length, worn by men and women in ancient Greece and Rome.
meanings.sent1: In the play, the actor wore a tunic to look like a character from ancient times.
meanings.sent2: She chose a comfortable tunic to wear during the historical reenactment.
meanings.sent3: The tunic was so big on him that he looked like a walking tent!
meanings.sent4: Her tunic was a bridge to the past, connecting her to the ancient world.
meanings.sent5: The tunic billowed in the wind as he walked, giving him a regal appearance.

meanings.definition: A similar garment worn in modern times, often as part of a uniform or costume.
meanings.sent1: The nurse put on her white tunic before starting her shift at the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The superhero costume included a colorful tunic with a symbol on the chest.
meanings.sent3: The tunic made him feel like a secret agent on a mission.
meanings.sent4: Her tunic was like a shield, protecting her from the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The tunic was the key element that completed the ensemble for the play.
